description: ChoicePoint was a data aggregation company that provided background checks, identity verification, and risk management services. It served clients in law enforcement, insurance, and corporate security before being acquired by LexisNexis in 2008. One of its offerings was CP Email Reporting Security, a software tool that protects sensitive information transmitted via email.

CP Email Reporting Security encrypted reports and attachments as CP9 files, ensuring only authorized recipients could access the contents. Users who encountered CP9 files were usually HR professionals, legal teams, compliance officers, or insurance agents working with sensitive personal or organizational data.
